TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit NativeMemory extends System.Object
public ref class NativeMemory abstract sealed

Docs.summary: This class contains methods that are mainly used to manage native memory.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void* AlignedAlloc (UIntPtr byteCount, UIntPtr alignment);
.method public static hidebysig void* AlignedAlloc(native unsigned int byteCount, native unsigned int alignment) cil managed
static member AlignedAlloc : unativeint * unativeint -> nativeptr<unit>
public: static void* AlignedAlloc(UIntPtr byteCount, UIntPtr alignment);

Docs.param: The size, in bytes, of the block to allocate.
The alignment, in bytes, of the block to allocate. This must be a power of 2.
Docs.summary: Allocates an aligned block of memory of the specified size and alignment, in bytes.
Docs.returns: A pointer to the allocated aligned block of memory.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This method allows `byteCount` to be `0` and will return a valid pointer that should not be dereferenced and that should be passed to free to avoid memory leaks.
This method is a thin wrapper over the C `aligned_alloc` API or a platform dependent aligned allocation API such as `_aligned_malloc` on Win32.
This method is not compatible with <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.NativeMemory.Free(System.Void*)> or <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.NativeMemory.Realloc(System.Void*,System.UIntPtr)>. Instead, call <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.NativeMemory.AlignedFree(System.Void*)> or <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.NativeMemory.AlignedRealloc(System.Void*,System.UIntPtr,System.UIntPtr)>.

Docs.exception: is not a power of two.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void AlignedFree (void* ptr);
.method public static hidebysig void AlignedFree(void* ptr) cil managed
static member AlignedFree : nativeptr<unit> -> unit
public: static void AlignedFree(void* ptr);

Docs.param: A pointer to the aligned block of memory that should be freed.
Docs.summary: Frees an aligned block of memory.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This method does nothing if `ptr` is `null`.
This method is a thin wrapper over the C `free` API or a platform dependent aligned free API such as `_aligned_free` on Win32.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void* AlignedRealloc (void* ptr, UIntPtr byteCount, UIntPtr alignment);
.method public static hidebysig void* AlignedRealloc(void* ptr, native unsigned int byteCount, native unsigned int alignment) cil managed
static member AlignedRealloc : nativeptr<unit> * unativeint * unativeint -> nativeptr<unit>
public: static void* AlignedRealloc(void* ptr, UIntPtr byteCount, UIntPtr alignment);

Docs.param: The previously allocated block of memory.
The size, in bytes, of the block to allocate.
The alignment, in bytes, of the block to allocate. This must be a power of 2.
Docs.summary: Reallocates an aligned block of memory of the specified size and alignment, in bytes.
Docs.returns: A pointer to the reallocated aligned block of memory.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This method acts as <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.NativeMemory.AlignedAlloc(System.UIntPtr,System.UIntPtr)> if `ptr` is `null`.
This method allows `byteCount` to be `0` and will return a valid pointer that should not be dereferenced and that should be passed to free to avoid memory leaks.
This method is a platform dependent aligned reallocation API such as `_aligned_realloc` on Win32.
This method is not compatible with <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.NativeMemory.Free(System.Void*)> or <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.NativeMemory.Realloc(System.Void*,System.UIntPtr)>. Instead, call <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.NativeMemory.AlignedFree(System.Void*)> or <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.NativeMemory.AlignedRealloc(System.Void*,System.UIntPtr,System.UIntPtr)>.

Docs.exception: is not a power of two.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void* Alloc (UIntPtr byteCount);
.method public static hidebysig void* Alloc(native unsigned int byteCount) cil managed
static member Alloc : unativeint -> nativeptr<unit>
public: static void* Alloc(UIntPtr byteCount);

Docs.param: The size, in bytes, of the block to allocate.
Docs.summary: Allocates a block of memory of the specified size, in bytes.
Docs.returns: A pointer to the allocated block of memory.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This method allows `byteCount` to be `0` and will return a valid pointer that should not be dereferenced and that should be passed to free to avoid memory leaks.
This method is a thin wrapper over the C `malloc` API.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void* Alloc (UIntPtr elementCount, UIntPtr elementSize);
.method public static hidebysig void* Alloc(native unsigned int elementCount, native unsigned int elementSize) cil managed
static member Alloc : unativeint * unativeint -> nativeptr<unit>
public: static void* Alloc(UIntPtr elementCount, UIntPtr elementSize);

Docs.param: The count, in elements, of the block to allocate.
The size, in bytes, of each element in the allocation.
Docs.summary: Allocates a block of memory of the specified size, in elements.
Docs.returns: A pointer to the allocated block of memory.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This method allows `elementCount` and/or `elementSize` to be `0` and will return a valid pointer that should not be dereferenced and that should be passed to free to avoid memory leaks.
This method is a thin wrapper over the C `malloc` API.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void* AllocZeroed (UIntPtr byteCount);

static member AllocZeroed : unativeint -> nativeptr<unit>
public: static void* AllocZeroed(UIntPtr byteCount);

Docs.param: The size, in bytes, of the block to allocate.
Docs.summary: Allocates and zeroes a block of memory of the specified size, in bytes.
Docs.returns: A pointer to the allocated and zeroed block of memory.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This method allows `byteCount` to be `0` and will return a valid pointer that should not be dereferenced and that should be passed to free to avoid memory leaks.
This method is a thin wrapper over the C `calloc` API.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void* AllocZeroed (UIntPtr elementCount, UIntPtr elementSize);
.method public static hidebysig void* AllocZeroed(native unsigned int elementCount, native unsigned int elementSize) cil managed
static member AllocZeroed : unativeint * unativeint -> nativeptr<unit>
public: static void* AllocZeroed(UIntPtr elementCount, UIntPtr elementSize);

Docs.param: The count, in elements, of the block to allocate.
The size, in bytes, of each element in the allocation.
Docs.summary: Allocates and zeroes a block of memory of the specified size, in elements.
Docs.returns: A pointer to the allocated and zeroed block of memory.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This method allows `elementCount` and `elementSize` to be `0`. It returns a valid pointer that should not be dereferenced and that should be passed to free to avoid memory leaks.
This method is a thin wrapper over the C `calloc` API.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void Free (void* ptr);
.method public static hidebysig void Free(void* ptr) cil managed
static member Free : nativeptr<unit> -> unit
public: static void Free(void* ptr);

Docs.param: A pointer to the block of memory that should be freed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This method does nothing if `ptr` is `null`.
This method is a thin wrapper over the C `free` API.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void* Realloc (void* ptr, UIntPtr byteCount);
.method public static hidebysig void* Realloc(void* ptr, native unsigned int byteCount) cil managed
static member Realloc : nativeptr<unit> * unativeint -> nativeptr<unit>
public: static void* Realloc(void* ptr, UIntPtr byteCount);

Docs.param: The previously allocated block of memory.
The size, in bytes, of the reallocated block.
Docs.summary: Reallocates a block of memory to be the specified size, in bytes.
Docs.returns: A pointer to the reallocated block of memory.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This method acts as <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.NativeMemory.Alloc(System.UIntPtr,System.UIntPtr)> if `ptr` is `null`.
This method allows `byteCount` to be `0` and will return a valid pointer that should not be dereferenced and that should be passed to free to avoid memory leaks.
This method is a thin wrapper over the C `realloc` API.
